Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different types of habitats, including one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can draw a variety of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can show patterns in the types of living things by comparing what is found in different habitats.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly separate and label the land habitat and water habitat.
The student can provide evidence in their drawing that shows the diversity of plant and animal life in each habitat.
